text: Nona Hendryx (born October 9, 1944) is an American singer-songwriter, record producer, musician, author, and actress. Hendryx is known for her work as a solo artist as well as for being one-third of the trio Labelle. She sang the hit "Lady Marmalade." She is a distant cousin of Jimi Hendrix. Hendryx is bisexual. ==References== ==Other websites== *Official website *Nona Hendryx Interview at Allaboutjazz.com Category:1944 births Category:Living people Category:American funk musicians Category:American funk singers Category:American soul musicians Category:American soul singers Category:American pop singers Category:American pop musicians Category:American R&B; musicians Category:American R&B; singers Category:American rock guitarists Category:American pianists Category:American singer-songwriters Category:Musicians from Trenton, New Jersey Category:Actors from Trenton, New Jersey Category:Singers from Trenton, New Jersey Category:Writers from Trenton, New Jersey Category:American record producers Category:Businesspeople from Trenton, New Jersey Category:American LGBT rights activists Category:LGBT businesspeople Category:LGBT actors Category:LGBT singers Category:LGBT musicians Category:American movie actors Category:American LGBT writers Category:Bisexual people Category:LGBT people from New Jersey Category:New wave singers
